Andrews-Cooper is an engineering firm specializing in product development and automation. Our 16+ year track record of success stems from our commitment to deliver quality results, to form lasting relationships with clients, and to engage our engineers with interesting problems and challenging projects. Since our inception in 2000, we have expanded to four offices across the country and have grown our team to over 60 talented people. While our company has evolved over the past 16 years, we have consistently held true to our core values – and our promise to deliver success on every project, every time.Currently, Andrews-Cooper is looking for Mechanical and Electrical Engineers for permanent full time positions in Oregon, Washington and Massachusetts. Please check out our website for a current list of openings (https://www.andrews-cooper.com/contact-us/join-our-team/)-	Implemented end-to-end recruiting strategy for entire organization-      Define communication strategy and process improvements for national organization.-      Purchased and executed sourcing and ATS contracts as needed-      Negotiate complex staffing contracts with both employees and fortune 500 clients.-      Determining current staffing needs and producing forecasts-	Developing talent acquisition strategies, processes and hiring plans-	Help our company find and retain excellent employees through the creation of training and development plans. -	Provide full-cycle recruiting and employment branding. -	Plan and conduct recruitment and selection processes (interviews, screening calls etc.)-	Working with hiring managers to ensure all needs are met. -	Provide pre-screening and screening activities for prospective employees, which may include calling previous employers and completing background screens and drug tests.

As the second largest technology Talent and Solutions provider in the world ($2.3b), our track record speaks for itself. We provide high-impact professionals, we deliver tangible and meaningful results powered by solutions that help create, innovate and lead change. Our business involves 4 major pillars: Recruitment, Consulting, Projects and Outsourcing. - Participate in Full Life Cycle Recruiting which includes: sourcing, pre-screening candidates, negotiating terms and rates for each consultant, coordinating and prepping the interview process, extending offers, closing candidates and maintaining a professional relationship with the candidates throughout the term of their contract and re-deploying candidates once a position is completed. - Source and screen potential IT candidates for contract, contract-to- hire and permanent openings.- Mentor and train newer recruiters on technologies, Boolean searches, time management, negotiation and best business practices.- Establish and maintain relationships with consultants, VMS staff, hiring managers and contractors in the Pacific NW. - Exceeded all company required KPIs weekly, monthly and quarterly- Utilize the following systems for sourcing and candidate tracking: Bullhorn Applicant Tracking System, LinkedIn Recruiter, Monster, Dice, Careerbuilder, Craigslist, Google and other online search engines.- Active member of tech user groups in the Portland marketing including SQAUG, Techies on Bikes, PADNUG, and various PMP meet-ups. Awards: -	Attendee of the 2014 Expert Achieves’ Circle for Randstad Technologies. This program highlights the top 10 percent of producers within the company. Awarded with the highest Client Submittals Award for EAC participants. -	2014 Power Perm Contest Winner-	2014 JO"liday Contest Winner-	Continuously ranked as number 1 for the highest submission and conversion numbers within the company based on years of experience.

Volunteering has always been a passion of mine. I am really glad to write this recommendation for Hilary as she is a true professional recruiter who deserves to be recommended for the hard work she does. I recently had the pleasure of working with her and I am so glad that I got this opportunity. Hilary is a highly dedicated professional who has the ability to go above and beyond the normal to achieve greater results. She is unlike normal recruiters who will try to impose their open positions on you with their version of twisted job responsibilities to make you fit for the role. She works for you to get you the job that you want to work on. She has this extra-ordinary ability to help and advice people on what can/cannot work for them, which I think is great to know from your recruiter. She does initial brainstorming sessions to understand you better and then find relevant job opportunities for you.Two thumbs up to Hilary and keep on doing this awesome work.

summary: I currently work as a Talent Acquisition Manager for a mid-sized engineering firm which services the needs of fortune 500 clients on a national scale. Over the past 10-years, my primary focus has been working with highly technical teams and individuals to achieve success whether it be HR, staffing or internal process improvements. The majority of this work has been within the IT, retail, engineering, consumer electronics, gaming, ecommerce, healthcare and banking sector. Background: My Masters degree from Northeastern University was focused on project management, organizational development and communication. My undergraduate degree was business administration and human resources. I’m a hard working team player with excellent problem solving skills that deals well with ambiguity.
